wtp-jsf-sdk-S-2.0M5-200702190651

When the JSF build is installed, the Page Designer becomes the default editor for HTML and JSP files.  When I try to open an HTML file, it fails with this error:

Created an attachment (id=59401)
Temp solution removing Web Page editor as the default editor

Nitin,

It appears that the HTML file you opened was outside of a dynamic web project. This was known and we will try to fix.  We will use this bug to track it.

For M5, and perhaps beyond, we will stop making the the Web Page Editor the default editor which will help the situation.   This is what the attached "temp" patch is for.  

Thanks,
GK
The fix in M5 is a workaround. Re-opening to target fix for M6.
BTW, besides working for any 'ol project, another requirement for "default editors" is that they are able to open files from CVS (which has some IStorageEditorInput, or similar).
It is IStorageEditorInputs, but additionally that applies for all supported file types, not just HTML.

Fixed as part of a large check-in done on 2/27/07.  

One can now use the Web Page Editor outside of a WTP Web App.   This editor remains non-default, at this time.
Just as an append, we should avoid setting this or any other editor in WTP as the explicitly default so we don't conflict with an adopter product.
